newsitem.title: USA: Banco de Colombia, Hispanoamericano end talks.
newsitem.headline: Banco de Colombia, Hispanoamericano end talks.

text.p: Banco de Colombia SA's majority shareholders, Isaac and Jaime Gilinski, said Friday they and Spain's Banco Central Hispanoamericano SA had jointly decided to end their discussions to form a strategic partnership.

A terse statement from Banco de Colombia, the country's second largest commercial bank in terms of assets, gave no reason for the change in plans, saying only that months of negotiations had broken off without any agreement.
In Bogota, bank spokesmen could not be reached for immediate comment on the announcement.
The company said it would announce its results for the first quarter of 1997 on April 22. It will hold a conference call at 1000 EDT/1400 EDT April 24.
Under terms of a preliminary accord reached last year, Banco Central would buy from 25 and 36 percent of Banco de Colombia's voting stock.

Delays in completing the merger, first announced in mid-1996, have capped Banco de Colombia's gains on local stock markets this year. It shed 1.96 percent in Bogota Thursday to close at a new low for 1997 of 400 pesos per share.
((-- Ian Simpson, Wall Street desk 212 859-1879 and Tom Brown, Bogota bureau 571 610-7944))
